description.narrative:
Oxfam Novib and its partners, Bedari and Indus Resource Center (IRC), will implement the MTBA programme in four Union Councils (UC), namely Larkana and Shikarpur in Northern Sindh and Muzaffargarh and Lodhran in South Punjab. Over the 5 years of implementation, the programme will target a total of 80 villages. Review of secondary literature indicates that the issue of child marriage is multilayered, spanning socio-cultural, religious, economic and legal dimensions. Any effective measures to address it, therefore, need to be multi-pronged confronting these various dimensions. Moreover, social norms and values, including honour and tradition, are major factors that play a role in early marriage. Therefore, interventions need to be comprehensive, with multiple entry-points, and, moreover, be firmly rooted with the local context. It is for this reason that the MTBA in Pakistan emphasises creating awareness and promoting harmful norms change whilst contributing to a more egalitarian and safe environment for adolescent girls. The MTBA will sensitise and build the capacity of youth to claim their rights and to protect themselves from child marriage.
The project is aimed ataddressing the issue of child marriages through multi-pronged strategies. Its planned outcomes are: Outcome 1: Young people are better informed about SRHR, including adverse effects of child marriage and empowered to voice their needs and rights Outcome 2: Increased access to formal education for girls at risk of and affected by child marriage Outcome 3: Increased access to economic opportunities for girls at risk of and affected by child marriage, and their families Outcome 4: Increased access to child protection systems for girls at risk of and affected by child marriage Outcome 5: Increased utilization of SRHR services that are responsive to the needs of young people, particular girls at risk of-, and affected by child marriage Outcome 6: Increased engagement and collective social action against child marriage and in support of ASRHR Outcome 7: Supportive rights-based legal and policy environment against child marriage

participating-org.narrative: Bedari has been working for the protection and empowerment of women and girls since 1992. It has implemented various projects and programs to provide support to women and girls. Its work includes direct support including legal aid, counseling and referral to survivors of violence, raising awareness in the communities about women#s issues, and advocacy/lobbying with government departments for women friendly policies and legislation. Education is one of the core programs of Bedari. It started its #Girls Post Primary Level Education Program# in 2006. It started off back then by providing direct support to 24 girls, and currently is supporting 100 girls. This support is provided as long as the girl completes her secondary education. In exceptional cases, the support has been continuedbeyond secondary level as well. Bedari starts off with community meetings to raise awareness about girls# education, identifying poorest of the poor families, and helping them get their girls readmitted to schools. Child Protection System is another of Bedari#s strengths. Bedari has been running #Girl Power Program# since 2011 in three districts of Punjab # Multan, Vehari, and Chakwal. It hasestablished a Child Helpline in the three districts. It has worked with the communities to raise awareness about child rights, and identified child rights activists during the awareness campaigns. The child rights activists were provided extensive training on children#s issues. Bedari established Surveillance System which consists of Child Protection Committees at the community level, while achild protection network is established at the district level. The district level network consists of representatives of Child Protection Committees, members of NGOs/CBOs working on child rights, and government officials of the relevant departments including Social Welfare Department, Police, Education Department and Health Department. SRHR is another important component of Bedari#s work. It has designed a program titled #Self-Growth Program#, which deals with life skills and SRHR issues. Bedari has been providing counseling and referral services to young and adolescent girls on SRHR issues through its Self Growth program and child helpline. However, Bedari has not been into service provision in this sector. It refers cases for services to relevant government and private institutions including Lady Health Workers, Population Welfare Centers, Rahnuma FPAP Centers, and Marie Stopes Society. Bedari in Target Districts: Bedari has been working in South Punjab since 2010. It had its regional office in Multan, and project offices in Muzaffargarhand Lodhran. In the two target districts, it worked with youth on peace issues. Bedari had introduced a unique concept of making use of arts and sports for peace education. It trained youth groups and they then organized various cultural and sports activities including poetry recitation sessions, music concerts, painting exhibitions, and tournaments. In Muzaffargarh, Bedari worked with 110 girls, and organized an athletics tournament, while in Lodhran it supported girls to play netball. In both districts, it conducted training sessions on Peace, and also Self Growth Sessions to educate them on various life skills including SRHR, communications skills,and negotiation skills Bedari currently has its office in Muzaffargarh, where it is working in collaboration with SPARC. Bedari is raising awareness in the communities for girls# education, and against child marriages. The project is at the very initial stage.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands
